title: 0, 1 Repel
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the number of 7-digit ternary strings that do not have any 0's next to any 1's. 00200211 and 00211200 are 2 strings to be counted, while 00200120 is a string not to be counted."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A ternary string is a string consisting of only 0's, 1's, and 2's.)"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" represent the number of y-digit ternary strings that ends with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
We find these recursive equations:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0_{n+1}=0_n+2_n,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1_{n+1}=1_n+2_n,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2_{n+1}=0_n+1_n+2_n."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0_1=1_1=2_1=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and we can find the answer: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0_7+1_7+2_7=169+169+169=\boxed{577}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

Can you explain me more easily.

title: Last Digit In A Huge Product
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the last digit of the number below."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (2^{2^0} + 1) ( 2^{2^1} +1 ) ( 2^{2^2} + 1)(2^{2^3} + 1) \\cdots (2^{2^{1024}} + 1 )  "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            The last two digits are 35."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The last two digits of the factors are
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"03, 05, 17, 57, \underbrace{37, 97, 17, 57}_{255\ \text{times}}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Now "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"37\cdot97\cdot17\cdot 57 \equiv 41"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mod 100, and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"41^5 \equiv 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" mod 100, so that the product is
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \times 5\times 17\times 57\times (41^5)^{51}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
mod 100, which simplifies to
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \times 5\times 17\times 57 \equiv 35"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
mod 100.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yeah, that was actually the original problem. :D

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I'm thinking what would be the last two digits ?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Multiply this by ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{2^0} - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to simplify the whole expression to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{2^{1025}} - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The last digit of any power of 2 follows the cyclic fashion 2, 4, 8, 6, 2, 4, etc...
As "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 ^ {1025}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by 4, the last digit of this number will be 6."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6 - 1 = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, final answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
